member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.CloudSpeechReflection
member.summary: Holder for reflection information generated from google/cloud/speech/v1/cloud_speech.proto

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognizeRequest
member.summary: The top-level message sent by the client for the `Recognize` method.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognizeRequest.Config
member.summary: *Required* Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognizeRequest.Audio
member.summary: *Required* The audio data to be recognized.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LongRunningRecognizeRequest
member.summary: The top-level message sent by the client for the `LongRunningRecognize` method.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LongRunningRecognizeRequest.Config
member.summary: *Required* Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LongRunningRecognizeRequest.Audio
member.summary: *Required* The audio data to be recognized.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognizeRequest
member.summary: The top-level message sent by the client for the `StreamingRecognize` method. Multiple `StreamingRecognizeRequest` messages are sent. The first message must contain a `streaming_config` message and must not contain `audio` data. All subsequent messages must contain `audio` data and must not contain a `streaming_config` message.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognizeRequest.StreamingConfig
member.summary: Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request. The first `StreamingRecognizeRequest` message must contain a `streaming_config` message.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognizeRequest.AudioContent
member.summary: The audio data to be recognized. Sequential chunks of audio data are sent in sequential `StreamingRecognizeRequest` messages. The first `StreamingRecognizeRequest` message must not contain `audio_content` data and all subsequent `StreamingRecognizeRequest` messages must contain `audio_content` data. The audio bytes must be encoded as specified in `RecognitionConfig`. Note: as with all bytes fields, protobuffers use a pure binary representation (not base64). See [audio limits](https://cloud.google.com/speech/limits#content).

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognizeRequest.StreamingRequestOneofCase
member.summary: Enum of possible cases for the "streaming_request" oneof.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognitionConfig
member.summary: Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognitionConfig.Config
member.summary: *Required* Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognitionConfig.SingleUtterance
member.summary:
*Optional* If `false` or omitted, the recognizer will perform continuous recognition (continuing to wait for and process audio even if the user pauses speaking) until the client closes the input stream (gRPC API) or until the maximum time limit has been reached. May return multiple `StreamingRecognitionResult`s with the `is_final` flag set to `true`.
If `true`, the recognizer will detect a single spoken utterance. When it detects that the user has paused or stopped speaking, it will return an `END_OF_SINGLE_UTTERANCE` event and cease recognition. It will return no more than one `StreamingRecognitionResult` with the `is_final` flag set to `true`.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognitionConfig.InterimResults
member.summary: *Optional* If `true`, interim results (tentative hypotheses) may be returned as they become available (these interim results are indicated with the `is_final=false` flag). If `false` or omitted, only `is_final=true` result(s) are returned.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig
member.summary: Provides information to the recognizer that specifies how to process the request.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.Encoding
member.summary: *Required* Encoding of audio data sent in all `RecognitionAudio` messages.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.SampleRateHertz
member.summary: *Required* Sample rate in Hertz of the audio data sent in all `RecognitionAudio` messages. Valid values are: 8000-48000. 16000 is optimal. For best results, set the sampling rate of the audio source to 16000 Hz. If that's not possible, use the native sample rate of the audio source (instead of re-sampling).

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.LanguageCode
member.summary: *Required* The language of the supplied audio as a [BCP-47](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt) language tag. Example: "en-US". See [Language Support](https://cloud.google.com/speech/docs/languages) for a list of the currently supported language codes.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.MaxAlternatives
member.summary: *Optional* Maximum number of recognition hypotheses to be returned. Specifically, the maximum number of `SpeechRecognitionAlternative` messages within each `SpeechRecognitionResult`. The server may return fewer than `max_alternatives`. Valid values are `0`-`30`. A value of `0` or `1` will return a maximum of one. If omitted, will return a maximum of one.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.ProfanityFilter
member.summary: *Optional* If set to `true`, the server will attempt to filter out profanities, replacing all but the initial character in each filtered word with asterisks, e.g. "f***". If set to `false` or omitted, profanities won't be filtered out.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.SpeechContexts
member.summary: *Optional* A means to provide context to assist the speech recognition.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the RecognitionConfig message type.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding
member.summary:
Audio encoding of the data sent in the audio message. All encodings support only 1 channel (mono) audio. Only `FLAC` includes a header that describes the bytes of audio that follow the header. The other encodings are raw audio bytes with no header.
For best results, the audio source should be captured and transmitted using a lossless encoding (`FLAC` or `LINEAR16`). Recognition accuracy may be reduced if lossy codecs, which include the other codecs listed in this section, are used to capture or transmit the audio, particularly if background noise is present.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.Flac
member.summary: [`FLAC`](https://xiph.org/flac/documentation.html) (Free Lossless Audio Codec) is the recommended encoding because it is lossless--therefore recognition is not compromised--and requires only about half the bandwidth of `LINEAR16`. `FLAC` stream encoding supports 16-bit and 24-bit samples, however, not all fields in `STREAMINFO` are supported.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.Mulaw
member.summary: 8-bit samples that compand 14-bit audio samples using G.711 PCMU/mu-law.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.Amr
member.summary: Adaptive Multi-Rate Narrowband codec. `sample_rate_hertz` must be 8000.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.AmrWb
member.summary: Adaptive Multi-Rate Wideband codec. `sample_rate_hertz` must be 16000.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.OggOpus
member.summary: Opus encoded audio frames in Ogg container ([OggOpus](https://wiki.xiph.org/OggOpus)). `sample_rate_hertz` must be 16000.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionConfig.Types.AudioEncoding.SpeexWithHeaderByte
member.summary: Although the use of lossy encodings is not recommended, if a very low bitrate encoding is required, `OGG_OPUS` is highly preferred over Speex encoding. The [Speex](https://speex.org/) encoding supported by Cloud Speech API has a header byte in each block, as in MIME type `audio/x-speex-with-header-byte`. It is a variant of the RTP Speex encoding defined in [RFC 5574](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5574). The stream is a sequence of blocks, one block per RTP packet. Each block starts with a byte containing the length of the block, in bytes, followed by one or more frames of Speex data, padded to an integral number of bytes (octets) as specified in RFC 5574. In other words, each RTP header is replaced with a single byte containing the block length. Only Speex wideband is supported. `sample_rate_hertz` must be 16000.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechContext
member.summary: Provides "hints" to the speech recognizer to favor specific words and phrases in the results.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechContext.Phrases
member.summary: *Optional* A list of strings containing words and phrases "hints" so that the speech recognition is more likely to recognize them. This can be used to improve the accuracy for specific words and phrases, for example, if specific commands are typically spoken by the user. This can also be used to add additional words to the vocabulary of the recognizer. See [usage limits](https://cloud.google.com/speech/limits#content).

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio
member.summary: Contains audio data in the encoding specified in the `RecognitionConfig`. Either `content` or `uri` must be supplied. Supplying both or neither returns [google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT][]. See [audio limits](https://cloud.google.com/speech/limits#content).

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.Content
member.summary: The audio data bytes encoded as specified in `RecognitionConfig`. Note: as with all bytes fields, protobuffers use a pure binary representation, whereas JSON representations use base64.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.Uri
member.summary: URI that points to a file that contains audio data bytes as specified in `RecognitionConfig`. Currently, only Google Cloud Storage URIs are supported, which must be specified in the following format: `gs://bucket_name/object_name` (other URI formats return [google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT][]). For more information, see [Request URIs](https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/reference-uris).

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.AudioSourceOneofCase
member.summary: Enum of possible cases for the "audio_source" oneof.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.FromStorageUri(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a with a property referring to a Google Cloud Storage URI.
member.param: A Google Cloud Storage URI, of the form gs://bucket-name/object-name. Must not be null.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.FetchFromUriAsync(System.Uri,System.Net.Http.HttpClient)
member.summary: Asynchronously constructs a by downloading data from the given URI.
member.param: The URI to fetch. Must not be null.
The to use to fetch the image, or null to use a default client.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The result will be the newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.FetchFromUriAsync(System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpClient)
member.summary: Asynchronously constructs a by downloading data from the given URI.
member.param: The URI to fetch. Must not be null.
The to use to fetch the image, or null to use a default client.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous operation. The result will be the newly created RecognitionAudio.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.FetchFromUri(System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpClient)
member.summary: Constructs a by downloading data from the given URI.
member.param: The URI to fetch. Must not be null.
The to use to fetch the image, or null to use a default client.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.FetchFromUri(System.Uri,System.Net.Http.HttpClient)
member.summary: Constructs a by downloading data from the given URI.
member.param: The URI to fetch. Must not be null.
The to use to fetch the image, or null to use a default client.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.FromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a by loading data from the given file path.
member.param: The file path to load RecognitionAudio data from. Must not be null.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.FromFileAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously constructs a by loading data from the given file path.
member.param: The file path to load RecognitionAudio data from. Must not be null.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.FromStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Constructs a by loading data from the given stream.
member.param: The stream to load RecognitionAudio data from. Must not be null.

member.summary: Asynchronously constructs a by loading data from the given stream.
member.param: The stream to load RecognitionAudio data from. Must not be null.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.FromBytes(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Constructs a from the given byte array.
member.remarks: This method copies the data from the byte array; modifications to after this method returns will not be reflected in the RecognitionAudio.
member.param: The bytes representing the raw RecognitionAudio data.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognitionAudio.FromBytes(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a from a section of the given byte array.
member.remarks: This method copies the data from the byte array; modifications to after this method returns will not be reflected in the RecognitionAudio.
member.param: The bytes representing the raw RecognitionAudio data.
The offset into the byte array of the start of the data to include in the RecognitionAudio.
The number of bytes to include in the RecognitionAudio.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognizeResponse
member.summary: The only message returned to the client by the `Recognize` method. It contains the result as zero or more sequential `SpeechRecognitionResult` messages.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.RecognizeResponse.Results
member.summary: *Output-only* Sequential list of transcription results corresponding to sequential portions of audio.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LongRunningRecognizeResponse
member.summary: The only message returned to the client by the `LongRunningRecognize` method. It contains the result as zero or more sequential `SpeechRecognitionResult` messages. It is included in the `result.response` field of the `Operation` returned by the `GetOperation` call of the `google::longrunning::Operations` service.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LongRunningRecognizeResponse.Results
member.summary: *Output-only* Sequential list of transcription results corresponding to sequential portions of audio.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LongRunningRecognizeMetadata
member.summary: Describes the progress of a long-running `LongRunningRecognize` call. It is included in the `metadata` field of the `Operation` returned by the `GetOperation` call of the `google::longrunning::Operations` service.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LongRunningRecognizeMetadata.ProgressPercent
member.summary: Approximate percentage of audio processed thus far. Guaranteed to be 100 when the audio is fully processed and the results are available.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LongRunningRecognizeMetadata.StartTime
member.summary: Time when the request was received.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LongRunningRecognizeMetadata.LastUpdateTime
member.summary: Time of the most recent processing update.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognizeResponse
P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Error
member.summary: *Output-only* If set, returns a [google.rpc.Status][] message that specifies the error for the operation.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Results
member.summary: *Output-only* This repeated list contains zero or more results that correspond to consecutive portions of the audio currently being processed. It contains zero or one `is_final=true` result (the newly settled portion), followed by zero or more `is_final=false` results.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.SpeechEventType
member.summary: *Output-only* Indicates the type of speech event.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the StreamingRecognizeResponse message type.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Types.SpeechEventType
member.summary: Indicates the type of speech event.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognizeResponse.Types.SpeechEventType.EndOfSingleUtterance
member.summary: This event indicates that the server has detected the end of the user's speech utterance and expects no additional speech. Therefore, the server will not process additional audio (although it may subsequently return additional results). The client should stop sending additional audio data, half-close the gRPC connection, and wait for any additional results until the server closes the gRPC connection. This event is only sent if `single_utterance` was set to `true`, and is not used otherwise.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognitionResult
member.summary: A streaming speech recognition result corresponding to a portion of the audio that is currently being processed.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognitionResult.Alternatives
member.summary: *Output-only* May contain one or more recognition hypotheses (up to the maximum specified in `max_alternatives`).

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognitionResult.IsFinal
member.summary: *Output-only* If `false`, this `StreamingRecognitionResult` represents an interim result that may change. If `true`, this is the final time the speech service will return this particular `StreamingRecognitionResult`, the recognizer will not return any further hypotheses for this portion of the transcript and corresponding audio.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.StreamingRecognitionResult.Stability
member.summary: *Output-only* An estimate of the likelihood that the recognizer will not change its guess about this interim result. Values range from 0.0 (completely unstable) to 1.0 (completely stable). This field is only provided for interim results (`is_final=false`). The default of 0.0 is a sentinel value indicating `stability` was not set.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechRecognitionResult
member.summary: A speech recognition result corresponding to a portion of the audio.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechRecognitionResult.Alternatives
member.summary: *Output-only* May contain one or more recognition hypotheses (up to the maximum specified in `max_alternatives`).

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechRecognitionAlternative.Transcript
member.summary: *Output-only* Transcript text representing the words that the user spoke.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechRecognitionAlternative.Confidence
member.summary: *Output-only* The confidence estimate between 0.0 and 1.0. A higher number indicates an estimated greater likelihood that the recognized words are correct. This field is typically provided only for the top hypothesis, and only for `is_final=true` results. Clients should not rely on the `confidence` field as it is not guaranteed to be accurate, or even set, in any of the results. The default of 0.0 is a sentinel value indicating `confidence` was not set.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.Speech
member.summary: Service that implements Google Cloud Speech API.

member.summary: Performs synchronous speech recognition: receive results after all audio has been sent and processed.
member.param: The request received from the client.
The context of the server-side call handler being invoked.
member.returns: The response to send back to the client (wrapped by a task).

member.param: The request received from the client.
The context of the server-side call handler being invoked.
member.returns: The response to send back to the client (wrapped by a task).

member.summary: Performs bidirectional streaming speech recognition: receive results while sending audio. This method is only available via the gRPC API (not REST).
member.param: Used for reading requests from the client.

member.returns: A task indicating completion of the handler.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LanguageCodes
member.summary: A helper class forming a hierarchy of supported language codes, via nested classes. All language codes are eventually represented as string constants. This is simply a code-convenient form of the table at https://cloud.google.com/speech/docs/languages. It is regenerated regularly, but not guaranteed to be complete at any moment in time; if the language you wish to use is present in the table but not covered here, please use the listed language code as a hard-coded string until this class catches up.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LanguageCodes.Arabic.StateofPalestine
member.summary: Language code for Arabic (State of Palestine)

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.LanguageCodes.Arabic.UnitedArabEmirates

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechSettings.GetDefaultRetryBackoff
member.returns: The "Default" retry backoff for RPC methods.
member.remarks:
The "Default" retry backoff for RPC methods is defined as:
Initial delay: 100 milliseconds
Maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Delay multiplier: 1.3

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechSettings.GetDefaultTimeoutBackoff
member.returns: The "Default" timeout backoff for RPC methods.
member.remarks:
The "Default" timeout backoff for RPC methods is defined as:
Initial timeout: 190000 milliseconds
Timeout multiplier: 1.0
Maximum timeout: 190000 milliseconds

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechSettings.RecognizeSettings
member.summary: for synchronous and asynchronous calls to SpeechClient.Recognize and SpeechClient.RecognizeAsync.
member.remarks:
The default SpeechClient.Recognize and SpeechClient.RecognizeAsync are:
Initial retry delay: 100 milliseconds
Retry delay multiplier: 1.3
Retry maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Initial timeout: 190000 milliseconds
Timeout multiplier: 1.0
Timeout maximum delay: 190000 milliseconds
Retry will be attempted on the following response status codes:
Default RPC expiration is 600000 milliseconds.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechSettings.LongRunningRecognizeSettings
member.summary: for synchronous and asynchronous calls to SpeechClient.LongRunningRecognize and SpeechClient.LongRunningRecognizeAsync.
member.remarks:
The default SpeechClient.LongRunningRecognize and SpeechClient.LongRunningRecognizeAsync are:
Initial retry delay: 100 milliseconds
Retry delay multiplier: 1.3
Retry maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Initial timeout: 190000 milliseconds
Timeout multiplier: 1.0
Timeout maximum delay: 190000 milliseconds
Retry will be attempted on the following response status codes:
Default RPC expiration is 600000 milliseconds.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechSettings.StreamingRecognizeStreamingSettings
member.remarks: The default local send queue size is 100.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Speech.V1.SpeechClient.ShutdownDefaultChannelsAsync
member.summary: Shuts down any channels automatically created by and . Channels which weren't automatically created are not affected.
member.remarks: After calling this method, further calls to and will create new channels, which could in turn be shut down by another call to this method.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous shutdown operation.
